abstract: Jamie Dimon, chairman and chief executive of JPMorgan, at an investor conference Tuesday, sent a warning to regulators about the rule changes in the Dodd-Frank act, saying that while “reform was needed,” some was “ill-conceived.”
snippet: Jamie Dimon, chairman and chief executive of JPMorgan, at an investor conference Tuesday, sent a warning to regulators about the rule changes in the Dodd-Frank act, saying that while “reform was needed,” some was “ill-conceived.”
lead_paragraph: Jamie Dimon, chairman and chief executive of JPMorgan, at an investor conference Tuesday, sent a warning to regulators about the rule changes in the Dodd-Frank act, saying that while “reform was needed,” some was “ill-conceived.”

headline.main: Confident in JPMorgan, Dimon Swats at Overhaul
